text: <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mediates <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated NF-kappaB and JNK activation

The results described above show that <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays an important role in <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated effector functions of B cells .
It follows that <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is likely a key mediator of <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signaling .

To test this hypothesis , we stimulated A20.2J and HOIP - deficient cells with <extra_id_0> CD154 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CD40 ligand <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) expressed by HI5 insect cells [ 7 ] , [ 8 ] and measured activation of the NF-kappaB and JNK pathways , two of the major transcriptional regulators activated by <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> [ 4 ] .

Cell - associated <extra_id_0> CD154 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was used as the stimulus in these experiments as it typically provides more robust , and therefore more readily detected , activation signals than does anti-CD40 antibody .
Activation of the canonical NF-kappaB pathway is initiated with the phosphorylation of IkappaB proteins by the IkappaB kinase complex ( IKK ) .
In resting cells , IkappaB proteins are responsible for sequestering <extra_id_0> NF-kappaB subunits <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the cytoplasm .

text: Phosphorylation by the IKK complex targets IkappaB proteins for ubiquitination and degradation , allowing NF-kappaB to enter the nucleus and activate gene expression .

<extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated phosphorylation and degradation of <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient cells was dramatically impaired relative to that observed in parental A20.2J cells ( Fig . 4 ) .

text: We also assayed activation of the stress - activated protein kinase JNK in response to <extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> engagement ( Fig . 4 ) .

<extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated JNK activation in <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - deficient cells was impaired as measured by phosphorylation of Thr183 and Tyr185 in JNK .

<extra_id_0> CD40 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced activation of NF-kappaB and JNK in <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - reconstituted cells was normal , demonstrating that the defects observed in gene - deficient cells were due to the absence of <extra_id_0> HOIP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .
